Ramon Ramos, the Trail Blazer rookie who suffered severe head injuries in an auto accident two months ago, was moved to the Rehabilitation Institute of Oregon in Portland, a spokeswoman, Marcia Williams, said yesterday.

Ramos, 22 years old, has been slowly emerging from a coma since he was thrown from his vehicle and severely bruised the base of his brain. ''He's not in a coma technically and yet he's not completely aware of his surroundings,'' Williams said.(AP) SPORTS PEOPLE: PRO BASKETBALL
